result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeremiah X. Montague was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay court costs.   **NOTE: THE DEFENDANT IS ORDERED TO PAY ALL COURT OBLIGATIONS TO THE CLERK OF COURTS OFFICE.   Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for two (2) years.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
-----------------------------------

IT IS HEREBY ORDERED THAT the defendant's excess work release funds be applied to any & all outstanding Court obligations while serving his mandatory jail sentence.
-----------------------------------

No alcohol.   No illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. No contact with victims. No contact with Lake Geneva YMCA. 
-----------------------------------

Follow any case plan given by doctors.
-----------------------------------
Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent.
-----------------------------------
Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge. 
-----------------------------------
Restitution, which has been paid up by defendant.

timeConds.notes: to commence on or before 09/30/2016 at 8:00 a.m. and with work release privileges.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Order as to Return of Property

Defendant Jeremiah X. Montague in court with attorney Stephen M Compton.  Diane M. Donohoo appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court in session @ 3:52 p.m. Appearances made. Atty. Compton makes an apology to the Court for being late for this hearing. Matter before the Court for Defendant's return of property. Court turns to ADA Donohoo whose only objection is that the defendant's appellate time limits have not expired. If the defendant waives all appellate rights, she would not have an objection. Court suggests defendant takes the stand so she can question defendant's intent. 
Mr. Montague is called to the stand, is duly sworn, and responds to direct exam of ADA Donohoo to address her concerns.
State calls Antoinette Antonopoulous who is duly sworn and responds to direct exam of ADA Donohoo.
ADA Donohoo makes a record that she is satisfied about the issue regarding appeal, but still has concerns as to rightful ownership of property as there are no receipts, photos, or photos. She suggests counsel and law enforcement to meet and go through the items in custody at Lake Geneva. ADA Donohoo responds to Court's questions regarding return of items that were stolen. 
4:05 p.m. - Atty. Compton makes a record that he cannot is not allowed to look at the items unless the Court signs order releasing items.
Court finds and is satisfied Mr. Montague has given up his right to appeal and is not a concern of the court. With respect to property, there is no evidence log in Court's possession to review. Court orders Lake Geneva Police Dept to sit down with the defendant/attorney at their convienance, to go through the items and return items identified.  If any items are not identified by the defendant, or are contraband, items will not be returned. Atty. Compton to prepare order. Court in recess @ 4:09 p.m.

11:00 am  Court in session.  Case called.  Appearances given.  
Andrew Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Attorney Stephen M Compton appeared.  
Atty Compton indicates his client does not appear because he told his client that he need not appear.  
This matter is before the Court for the defendant's Motion to retrieve personal belongings.  
Atty Herrmann indicates that the State's concern is that they do not want this coming back down the road that the defendantt only gave up his rights in order to get his stuff back.  
Atty Compton apologizes and didn't realize the State would want the deft present.  Court asks what property we are talking about?  Atty Herrmann reviews his file to see what items were seized.  Court can see how the backpack might be an issue and believes the best way to handle this is to adjourn the hearing and have the defendant present in Court.  
Motion hearing scheduled for September 29, 2016 at 03:30 pm.  
11:05 am  Court in recess.
Motion hearing on September 15, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Letter from Atty Compton
Motion to Retrieve Personal Belongings
BOND QUASHED
Application for Jail Time Credit form
